availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Howe Richart (Bath County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, Merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Morrow Richart. Father to James Richart, Theodore Richart. and Mary C. Richart. Married to Mary Richart. Father of Mary C. Richart. Merchant in Bath County in 1850. Merchant in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 1.
Find A Grave, "Joseph Howe Richart (July 4, 1815-Jan. 19, 1906)," Memorial #45169429, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/45169429 (accessed March 30, 2020).
